newsitem.title: CANADA: Fletcher Canada braces for long strike.
newsitem.headline: Fletcher Canada braces for long strike.

text.p: Fletcher Challenge Canada Ltd said on Tuesday it was bracing for a long strike at its three British Columbia pulp and paper mills.
The unions representing the 2,400 workers at the mills announced earlier today they would go on strike on July 14 after contract talks broke off.
Fletcher negotiator Howard Burleigh said the company anticipated a strike lasting at least a month.
"We indicated we were very interested in continuing bargaining with them. (But) they are very firm in their position," Burleigh said.
Every day the mills are shut means lost production of about 4,700 tonnes of pulp and paper or about 1.7 million tonnes a year. Burleigh declined to comment on the daily financial cost of a strike.
Fletcher was hit by a six-week strike in its last contract negotiations that ended in early 1995.
